commit_msg:
drm/amdgpu: fix multiple memory leaks in acp_hw_init

In acp_hw_init there are some allocations that needs to be released in
case of failure:

1- adev->acp.acp_genpd should be released if any allocation attemp for
adev->acp.acp_cell, adev->acp.acp_res or i2s_pdata fails.
2- all of those allocations should be released if
mfd_add_hotplug_devices or pm_genpd_add_device fail.
3- Release is needed in case of time out values expire.

Reviewed-by: Christian KÃ¶nig <christian.koenig@amd.com>
Signed-off-by: Navid Emamdoost <navid.emamdoost@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Deucher <alexander.deucher@amd.com>
Bug Filter Response:
The patch addresses memory leaks in the acp_hw_init function by ensuring all allocated resources are properly released upon failure, preventing resource exhaustion and system instability. This is a reliability fix rather than a security vulnerability.

**Final Classification:** Defect Remediation & Feature Upgrades  
**Confidence Score:** 0.9
